main_definition: To give back or provide something in return, especially as a result of an exchange.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The act of giving back money received from a purchase or transaction.
meanings_and_examples.example: When I returned the book to the library, I had to pay a fine.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To go back to a previous place, condition, or state.
meanings_and_examples.example: After his vacation in Hawaii, he decided to return home and resume work.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The reimbursement of an amount owed by someone who has borrowed it.
meanings_and_examples.example: When she returned the money she borrowed from her friend, they were both relieved.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A financial return on investment or capital gains.
meanings_and_examples.example: He received a significant returns when he sold his stocks at a higher price than he bought them for.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To give back something in response to receiving it, as part of an exchange.
meanings_and_examples.example: After I borrowed your phone charger, I returned the favor by lending you my laptop charger.
